pullRequest.body:
Given a function `f : M → N` (`M` and `N` additive commutative groups) `QuadraticMap.polar f : M → M → N` is always symmetric and so has a lift to `Sym2 M → N`, which is defined as `QuadraticMap.polarSym2` in this PR.

This definition allows the statements of `QuadraticMap.map_sum` and `QuadraticMap.map_sum'` to be given in a more pleasing form.

The intention is to use `polarSym2` more extensively in #18578.

---

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Should `polar` and friends be in the `Function` namespace rather than the `QuadraticMap` namespace?
CC: @eric-wieser @YaelDillies

> Should `polar` and friends be in the `Function` namespace rather than the `QuadraticMap` namespace?

No strong opinion. Do people use the polar in cases where it's not bilinear?

bors merge

Thanks!

  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13247868395/job/36978640528)
Canceled.
@eric-wieser the build/merge seems to have failed for some reason. Perhaps you could please try again?

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13252739589/job/36993894285)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13252739589/job/36993894124)
bors merge
modulo Eric's comments
modulo Eric's comments
bors merge

```suggestion
Lift the polar to `Sym2`
```

Any reason you're not writing this as
```suggestion
      + ∑ ij ∈ s.sym2 with ¬ ij.IsDiag, polar_sym2 Q (ij.map f) := by
```
?
I tried `((polar_sym2 Q) ∘ (ij.map f))` which was wrong.
This lemma is backwards, since in general things should be named after their LHS. Can you flip the equality here and before?
Done, and in `lift_apply_map`.
Perhaps  `lift_map` or `lift_apply_map`, since there's no `comp` in the statement.
Please add a simp lemma about this and `Sym2.mk`

I would guess
```suggestion
  Sym2.lift ⟨polar f, polar_comm _⟩
```
or similar works here

```suggestion
lemma polarSym2_sym2Mk (f : M → N) (x y : M ) : polarSym2 f (Sym2.mk (x, y)) = polar f x y := rfl
```

optional:
```suggestion
lemma polarSym2_sym2Mk (f : M → N) (x y : M ) : polarSym2 f (.mk (x, y)) = polar f x y := rfl
```

```suggestion
    lift f ∘ map g = lift ⟨fun (c₁ c₂ : γ) => f.val (g c₁) (g c₂), fun _ _ => f.prop _ _⟩ :=
```

```suggestion
    Q (∑ i ∈ s, f i) = ∑ ij ∈ s.sym2, polarSym2 Q (ij.map f) - ∑ i ∈ s, Q (f i) := by
```

```suggestion
lemma polarSym2_sym2Mk (f : M → N) (xy : M × M) : polarSym2 f (.mk xy) = polar f xy.1 xy,2 := rfl
```
which I think you can use to shorten your proof below.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(LinearAlgebra/QuadraticForm/Basic): Define the lift of the polar to Sym2
